questions:

options:
An attempt to obtain sensitive information
by disguising as a trustworthy entity
Click on the links to investigate
Forward to your colleagues for their opinions
Click on the attachment to see what it is.
Delete the email without opening the attachment.
Forward the email to your boss to see if it is safe.

Reply to the email and ask for more
information about the attachment.
Install anti-virus software on your computer
Keep your operating system and software up to date
Use strong, unique passwords for each account

The email address of the sender
looks suspicious or unfamiliar

The email contains a lot of
spelling or grammatical errors

The email requests personal
information or asks for money
Pretending to be a CEO or high-level executive
Sending spam emails to a large group of people

Using social engineering to
gain access to a victim's account
A type of virus that infects your computer
A type of software used for editing photos

A type of malware that encrypts your files
and demands payment for decryption

Educate yourself on how to avoid
ransomware attacks
Try to decrypt your files yourself

Wipe your computer and restore
your files from a backup
Ignore it and hope it goes away

Opening email attachments
from unknown senders
